reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the hotel is a bit away from the JR station, but still in 5 min walking distance, so it is great... i stayed there for 3 separate nights... so i stayed in 3 different rooms... rooms have limited control on the air conditioning... i was there in mid-nov... they have heat at night and it was too hot for me... so i needed to open the window... BUT try to avoid rooms facing the main street... otherwise it will be just too noisy... small room as usual but it goes with all u need...
reviews.title: room is small as usual but in a good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For the price paid this hotel was good value for money in a handy location. The room was small but clean and I found it suitable for a short stay. If I had been staying longer the room size may have been a problem (more luggage and shopping) but perfect for a quick trip to Fukuoka.
reviews.title: Good value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our second visit to the B Hakata. Again we stayed here 2 nights. We choose to stay here again due to the hotel's convenience for Hakata Station. It is only about 5 minutes walk from the station's east gate, turn right on the main road.
reviews.title: Return to the B Hakata

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is comfortable and clean. The staff are very pleasant. The hotel is lovely and quiet and we have always had a good night's sleep here.
reviews.title: Close to the Hakata station

reviews.text: The hotel is near convenience stores. A hot water pot and tea bags are provided in the room. Free coffee is available downstairs.
reviews.title: You get what you pay for.

reviews.text: We have stayed in their hotel (standard double room) last week.
reviews.title: The room is too small

reviews.title: Very close to JR station, room is a bit small

reviews.text: was so small. It is out of my expectation and the location is not convenience. I remembered that I stayed in the B in Kobe and their room and service is better. I could have their coffee every day. When I stayed in the B Hakata, they said that their coffee machine in the lobby is under maintainance. We were happy with the hotel
reviews.text: Very close to the JR station but was hard to find on the first day due to the wrong direction from yahoo map, since the hotel is located in the main street and it suggested us to go to the back?!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room is very small but it is ok for the price that I paid but the desk chair is bit in the way, can barely walk to the bed end even the chair is not being pull out.
reviews.title: Close to station, small rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: B Hakata is a modern and clean hotel. The staff is friendly, and many speak English. My wife and I stayed here for two nights, and our accomodation package included a buffet breakfast, which was delicious every morning.
reviews.title: Great Location...Nice Room!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are clean, modern, and small...typical for Japanese standards. The bathroom was slightly elevated from the rest of the room floor level, you had to step up 8" or so to go into the bathroom. And to get into the deep soaking tub/shower you really had to step (almost "pole vault" lol) into the tub. But once you got acclimated to the calisthenics required to take a shower, it was quite comfortable with excellent water pressure. The toilet was sophisticated, with more features than some American automobiles...we're talking heated seat, bidet feature, easy to flush. Just about everything you'd want in a toilet.
reviews.title: decent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is a wired LAN access in every room, but I opted to go to the lobby for their WiFi. I didn't have a LAN connector to hook up my tablet or smartphone, so the WiFi was my only option.
reviews.title: Nice Room, Great location

reviews.text: The room is equipped with a small flat screen TV carrying only Japanese language channels.
reviews.title: Nothing but average

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I enjoyed this hotel and would recommend it for travelers on a budget who are staying briefly in Fukuoka. Because of the size of the room, travelers with a lot of luggage may not find the accommodations large enough for their comfort.
reviews.title: "nice place."

reviews.text: Typical small Japanese business hotel rooms however very very clean and located near numerous shopping locations and transport links. Excellent if traveling on a budget or just what some place clean and quiet to stay.
reviews.title: Great location, great prices

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the B Hakata Hotel for three nights. Ther hotel is very close to Hakata Station. From Hakata Station exit through the Chiusi Gate, walk to main road, turn right, when you see the Richmong Hotel on your left cross the road at the crossroads and walk up the side street to your left, the B hAkata is just past the Familymart and Japanese School of Home Baking.
reviews.title: An Enjoyable Stay

reviews.text: Check in was quick, efficient and friendly. We had a double room which was small but much bigger than the one we stayed in for the first three night of our stay. The room was very clean, the bed was comfortable. There was an open wardrobe space and two drawers. A kettle and tea bags were provided. Coffee was available free 24 hours a day from a machine in the lobby. There was no safe in the room, but safety deposit box was available at reception.
reviews.title: Very clean and close to JR station

reviews.text: There were large refillable bottles of liquid soap, shampoo, conditioner, tooth brushes/toothpaste, razors and hair brushes provided.
reviews.title: A good base.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was very close to a Family Mart convenience store. There was a chinese restaurant further along the street. It was very convenient for Hakata Station - great for us as we were travelling around on a Kyushu Rail Pass at this point. Hakata station also had great idiot proof I speak no japanese restaurants with plastic food displays. We had a very nice curry in San Marco Restaurant there and I did not even know the Italians were noted for curries.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, not sure I would stay again though.
